General course objectives:
General course objectives
To enable participants to model what happens with water during extreme weather situations. The course will involve general considerations for how water propagates through the city, setting up models to dynamically model water flows and using them to perform hazard assessments. We will further introduce economic concepts for flood risk assessment and use them to find cost-effective flood adaptation measures in a concrete case. It is assumed, that students are familiar with basic GIS analysis and formats used by the ArcGIS software, as well as with the application of hydrodynamic models.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Understand the processes leading to flooding in urban areas
Perform GIS analysis of Digital Terrain Models/Digital Elevation Models to identify the vulnerable areas of a city in regards to flooding
Create a hydrodynamic model for urban flood modelling
Perform screening analysis by means of hand calculations and ID simulations to identify suitable adaptation options
Document suitable the solution using a hydrodynamic model
Calculate expected annual damage based on flood simulations
Understand the definitions of hazards, vulnerabilities, and exposure in an urban flood context
Explain how to perform an urban flood risk assessment
Content: Urban flooding, advanced GIS analysis, urban drainage systems, hydrodynamic flood models, expected Annual Damage
